title: Human-imperceptible, Machine-recognizable Images. (arXiv:2306.03679v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Massive human-related data is collected to train neural networks for computer vision tasks. A major conflict is exposed relating to software engineers between better developing AI systems and distancing from the sensitive training data. To reconcile this conflict, this paper proposes an efficient privacy-preserving learning paradigm, where images are first encrypted to become ``human-imperceptible, machine-recognizable'' via one of the two encryption strategies: (1) random shuffling to a set of equally-sized patches and (2) mixing-up sub-patches of the images. Then, minimal adaptations are made to vision transformer to enable it to learn on the encrypted images for vision tasks, including image classification and object detection. Extensive experiments on ImageNet and COCO show that the proposed paradigm achieves comparable accuracy with the competitive methods. Decrypting the encrypted images requires solving an NP-hard jigsaw puzzle or an ill-posed inverse problem, which is empirical

translated_title: 人类不可感知、机器可识别的图像
translated_abstract: 大量与人类相关的数据被收集用于训练神经网络进行计算机视觉任务。我们发现了一种关于软件工程师的重大冲突：在更好地开发人工智能系统与远离敏感训练数据之间存在一大矛盾。为了解决这个问题，本文提出了一种高效的隐私保护学习范式，其中图像被加密成“人类不可感知，机器可识别”状态，通过以下两种加密策略之一来实现：(1) 将图像随机洗牌成一组相等大小的小块，(2) 对图像的子块进行混合。然后，对视觉转换器进行最小的适配，使其能够学习加密图像的计算机视觉任务，包括图像分类和目标检测。在 ImageNet 和 COCO 上进行了广泛的实验，结果表明，所提出的方法在准确性方面与竞争方法相当。解密加密图像需要解决 NP 难的拼图问题或病态的反问题，这是经验证明的。
tldr: 本文提出了一种高效的隐私保护学习范式，通过加密图像实现人类不可感知但机器可识别，并使用经过最小适配的视觉转换器完成计算机视觉任务。实验证明该方法准确性与竞争方法相当。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes an efficient privacy-preserving learning paradigm, which achieves human-imperceptible yet machine-recognizable images through encryption and enables the vision transformer to learn on encrypted images for vision tasks including classification and detection. Extensive experiments show the proposed method achieves comparable accuracy with competitive methods.
